16 // decide whether we want C and/or C++ bindings (default matches host language)
17 //
18 // each set of bindings has its own include-once ifdef armor, allowing the
19 // second set of bindings to be loaded even if the first already has been
20 #if !defined(LEGION_ENABLE_C_BINDINGS) && !defined(LEGION_DISABLE_C_BINDINGS)
21  #ifndef __cplusplus
22  #define LEGION_ENABLE_C_BINDINGS
23  #endif
24 #endif
25 #if !defined(LEGION_ENABLE_CXX_BINDINGS) && !defined(LEGION_DISABLE_CXX_BINDINGS)
26  #ifdef __cplusplus
27  #define LEGION_ENABLE_CXX_BINDINGS
28  #endif
29 #endif
30 
31 #ifdef LEGION_ENABLE_C_BINDINGS
32 #include "legion/legion_c.h"
33 #endif
34 
35 #ifdef LEGION_ENABLE_CXX_BINDINGS
36 #ifndef __LEGION_RUNTIME_H__
37 #define __LEGION_RUNTIME_H__
38 
52 #if __cplusplus < 201103L
53 #error "Legion requires C++11 as the minimum standard version"
54 #endif
55 
56 #include "legion/legion_types.h"
57 #include "legion/legion_domain.h"
58 #include "legion/legion_constraint.h"
59 #include "legion/legion_redop.h"

61 #define LEGION_PRINT_ONCE(runtime, ctx, file, fmt, ...) \
62 { \
63  char message[4096]; \
64  snprintf(message, 4096, fmt, ##__VA_ARGS__); \
65  runtime->print_once(ctx, file, message); \
66 }

85  class IndexSpace {
86  public:
87  static const IndexSpace NO_SPACE;
88  protected:
89  // Only the runtime should be allowed to make these
90  FRIEND_ALL_RUNTIME_CLASSES
91  IndexSpace(IndexSpaceID id, IndexTreeID tid, TypeTag tag);
92  public:
93  IndexSpace(void);
94  public:
95  inline bool operator==(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
96  inline bool operator!=(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
97  inline bool operator<(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
98  inline bool operator>(const IndexSpace &rhs) const;
99  inline IndexSpaceID get_id(void) const { return id; }
100  inline IndexTreeID get_tree_id(void) const { return tid; }
101  inline bool exists(void) const { return (id != 0); }
102  inline TypeTag get_type_tag(void) const { return type_tag; }
103  inline int get_dim(void) const;
104  protected:
105  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os,
106  const IndexSpace& is);
107  IndexSpaceID id;
108  IndexTreeID tid;
109  TypeTag type_tag;
110  };

239  LogicalRegion(RegionTreeID tid, IndexSpace index, FieldSpace field);
240  public:
241  LogicalRegion(void);
242  public:
243  inline bool operator==(const LogicalRegion &rhs) const;
244  inline bool operator!=(const LogicalRegion &rhs) const;
245  inline bool operator<(const LogicalRegion &rhs) const;
246  public:
247  inline IndexSpace get_index_space(void) const { return index_space; }
248  inline FieldSpace get_field_space(void) const { return field_space; }
249  inline RegionTreeID get_tree_id(void) const { return tree_id; }
250  inline bool exists(void) const { return (tree_id != 0); }
251  inline TypeTag get_type_tag(void) const
252  { return index_space.get_type_tag(); }

254  protected:
255  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os,
256  const LogicalRegion& lr);
257  // These are private so the user can't just arbitrarily change them
258  RegionTreeID tree_id;
259  IndexSpace index_space;
260  FieldSpace field_space;
261  };

519  class UntypedBuffer : public Unserializable<UntypedBuffer> {
520  public:
521  UntypedBuffer(void) : args(NULL), arglen(0) { }
522  UntypedBuffer(const void *arg, size_t argsize)
523  : args(const_cast<void*>(arg)), arglen(argsize) { }
524  UntypedBuffer(const UntypedBuffer &rhs)
525  : args(rhs.args), arglen(rhs.arglen) { }
526  UntypedBuffer(UntypedBuffer &&rhs) noexcept
527  : args(rhs.args), arglen(rhs.arglen) { }
528  public:
529  inline size_t get_size(void) const { return arglen; }
530  inline void* get_ptr(void) const { return args; }
531  public:
532  inline bool operator==(const UntypedBuffer &arg) const
533  { return (args == arg.args) && (arglen == arg.arglen); }
534  inline bool operator<(const UntypedBuffer &arg) const
535  { return (args < arg.args) && (arglen < arg.arglen); }
536  inline UntypedBuffer& operator=(const UntypedBuffer &rhs)
537  { args = rhs.args; arglen = rhs.arglen; return *this; }
538  inline UntypedBuffer& operator=(UntypedBuffer &&rhs) noexcept
539  { args = rhs.args; arglen = rhs.arglen; return *this; }
540  private:
541  void *args;
542  size_t arglen;
543  };
544  // This typedef is here for backwards compatibility since we
545  // used to call an UntypedBuffer a TaskArgument
546  typedef UntypedBuffer TaskArgument;
547 
558  class ArgumentMap : public Unserializable<ArgumentMap> {
559  public:
560  ArgumentMap(void);
561  ArgumentMap(const FutureMap &rhs);
562  ArgumentMap(const ArgumentMap &rhs);
563  ArgumentMap(ArgumentMap &&rhs) noexcept;
564  ~ArgumentMap(void);
565  public:
566  ArgumentMap& operator=(const FutureMap &rhs);
567  ArgumentMap& operator=(const ArgumentMap &rhs);
568  ArgumentMap& operator=(ArgumentMap &&rhs) noexcept;
569  inline bool operator==(const ArgumentMap &rhs) const
570  { return (impl == rhs.impl); }
571  inline bool operator<(const ArgumentMap &rhs) const
572  { return (impl < rhs.impl); }
573  inline bool exists(void) const { return (impl != NULL); }
574  public:
580  bool has_point(const DomainPoint &point);
587  void set_point(const DomainPoint &point, const UntypedBuffer &arg,
588  bool replace = true);
595  void set_point(const DomainPoint &point, const Future &f,
596  bool replace = true);
602  bool remove_point(const DomainPoint &point);
610  UntypedBuffer get_point(const DomainPoint &point) const;
611  public:
620  template<typename PT, unsigned DIM>
621  inline void set_point_arg(const PT point[DIM], const UntypedBuffer &arg,
622  bool replace = false);
628  template<typename PT, unsigned DIM>
629  inline bool remove_point(const PT point[DIM]);
630  private:
631  FRIEND_ALL_RUNTIME_CLASSES
632  Internal::ArgumentMapImpl *impl;
633  private:
634  explicit ArgumentMap(Internal::ArgumentMapImpl *i);
635  };

870  struct RegionRequirement {
871  public:

878  const std::vector<FieldID> &instance_fields,
879  PrivilegeMode _priv, CoherenceProperty _prop,
880  LogicalRegion _parent, MappingTagID _tag = 0,
881  bool _verified = false);
885  RegionRequirement(LogicalPartition pid, ProjectionID _proj,
886  const std::set<FieldID> &privilege_fields,
887  const std::vector<FieldID> &instance_fields,
888  PrivilegeMode _priv, CoherenceProperty _prop,
889  LogicalRegion _parent, MappingTagID _tag = 0,
890  bool _verified = false);
894  RegionRequirement(LogicalRegion _handle, ProjectionID _proj,
895  const std::set<FieldID> &privilege_fields,
896  const std::vector<FieldID> &instance_fields,
897  PrivilegeMode _priv, CoherenceProperty _prop,
898  LogicalRegion _parent, MappingTagID _tag = 0,
899  bool _verified = false);
904  RegionRequirement(LogicalRegion _handle,
905  const std::set<FieldID> &privilege_fields,
906  const std::vector<FieldID> &instance_fields,
907  ReductionOpID op, CoherenceProperty _prop,
908  LogicalRegion _parent, MappingTagID _tag = 0,
909  bool _verified = false);
913  RegionRequirement(LogicalPartition pid, ProjectionID _proj,
914  const std::set<FieldID> &privilege_fields,
915  const std::vector<FieldID> &instance_fields,
916  ReductionOpID op, CoherenceProperty _prop,
917  LogicalRegion _parent, MappingTagID _tag = 0,
918  bool _verified = false);
922  RegionRequirement(LogicalRegion _handle, ProjectionID _proj,
923  const std::set<FieldID> &privilege_fields,
924  const std::vector<FieldID> &instance_fields,
925  ReductionOpID op, CoherenceProperty _prop,
926  LogicalRegion _parent, MappingTagID _tag = 0,
927  bool _verified = false);
928  public:
929  // Analogous constructors without the privilege and instance fields
930  RegionRequirement(LogicalRegion _handle, PrivilegeMode _priv,
931  CoherenceProperty _prop, LogicalRegion _parent,
932  MappingTagID _tag = 0, bool _verified = false);
933  RegionRequirement(LogicalPartition pid, ProjectionID _proj,
934  PrivilegeMode _priv, CoherenceProperty _prop,
935  LogicalRegion _parent, MappingTagID _tag = 0,
936  bool _verified = false);
937  RegionRequirement(LogicalRegion _handle, ProjectionID _proj,
938  PrivilegeMode _priv, CoherenceProperty _prop,
939  LogicalRegion _parent, MappingTagID _tag = 0,
940  bool _verified = false);
941  RegionRequirement(LogicalRegion _handle, ReductionOpID op,
942  CoherenceProperty _prop, LogicalRegion _parent,
943  MappingTagID _tag = 0, bool _verified = false);
944  RegionRequirement(LogicalPartition pid, ProjectionID _proj,
945  ReductionOpID op, CoherenceProperty _prop,
946  LogicalRegion _parent, MappingTagID _tag = 0,
947  bool _verified = false);
948  RegionRequirement(LogicalRegion _handle, ProjectionID _proj,
949  ReductionOpID op, CoherenceProperty _prop,
950  LogicalRegion _parent, MappingTagID _tag = 0,
951  bool _verified = false);
952  public:
953  RegionRequirement(const RegionRequirement &rhs);
954  ~RegionRequirement(void);
955  RegionRequirement& operator=(const RegionRequirement &req);
956  public:
957  bool operator==(const RegionRequirement &req) const;
958  bool operator<(const RegionRequirement &req) const;
959  public:
965  inline RegionRequirement& add_field(FieldID fid, bool instance = true);
966  inline RegionRequirement& add_fields(const std::vector<FieldID>& fids,
967  bool instance = true);
968 
969  inline RegionRequirement& add_flags(RegionFlags new_flags);
970  public:
971  inline bool is_verified(void) const
972  { return (flags & LEGION_VERIFIED_FLAG); }
973  inline bool is_no_access(void) const
974  { return (flags & LEGION_NO_ACCESS_FLAG); }
975  inline bool is_restricted(void) const
976  { return (flags & LEGION_RESTRICTED_FLAG); }
977  LEGION_DEPRECATED("Premapping regions is no longer supported.")
978  inline bool must_premap(void) const
979  { return false; }
980  public:
981  const void* get_projection_args(size_t *size) const;
982  void set_projection_args(const void *args, size_t size, bool own = false);
983  public:
984  bool has_field_privilege(FieldID fid) const;
985  public:
986  // Fields used for controlling task launches
987  LogicalRegion region;
988  LogicalPartition partition;
989  std::set<FieldID> privilege_fields;
990  std::vector<FieldID> instance_fields;
991  PrivilegeMode privilege;
992  CoherenceProperty prop;
993  LogicalRegion parent;
994  ReductionOpID redop;

1502  struct StaticDependence : public Unserializable<StaticDependence> {
1503  public:
1504  StaticDependence(void);
1505  StaticDependence(unsigned previous_offset,
1506  unsigned previous_req_index,
1507  unsigned current_req_index,
1508  DependenceType dtype,
1509  bool validates = false,
1510  bool shard_only = false);
1511  public:
1512  inline void add_field(FieldID fid);
1513  public:
1514  // The relative offset from this operation to
1515  // previous operation in the stream of operations
1516  // (e.g. 1 is the operation launched immediately before)
1517  unsigned previous_offset;
1518  // Region requirement of the previous operation for the dependence
1519  unsigned previous_req_index;
1520  // Region requirement of the current operation for the dependence
1521  unsigned current_req_index;
1522  // The type of the dependence
1523  DependenceType dependence_type;
1524  // Whether this requirement validates the previous writer
1525  bool validates;
1526  // Whether this dependence is a shard-only dependence for
1527  // control replication or it depends on all other copies
1528  bool shard_only;
1529  // Fields that have the dependence
1530  std::set<FieldID> dependent_fields;
1531  };

1540  struct TaskLauncher {
1541  public:
1542  TaskLauncher(void);
1543  TaskLauncher(TaskID tid,
1544  UntypedBuffer arg,
1545  Predicate pred = Predicate::TRUE_PRED,
1546  MapperID id = 0,
1547  MappingTagID tag = 0,
1548  UntypedBuffer map_arg = UntypedBuffer(),
1549  const char *provenance = "");
1550  public:
1551  inline IndexSpaceRequirement&
1552  add_index_requirement(const IndexSpaceRequirement &req);
1553  inline RegionRequirement&
1554  add_region_requirement(const RegionRequirement &req);
1555  inline void add_field(unsigned idx, FieldID fid, bool inst = true);
1556  public:
1557  inline void add_future(Future f);
1558  inline void add_grant(Grant g);
1559  inline void add_wait_barrier(PhaseBarrier bar);
1560  inline void add_arrival_barrier(PhaseBarrier bar);
1561  inline void add_wait_handshake(LegionHandshake handshake);
1562  inline void add_arrival_handshake(LegionHandshake handshake);
1563  public:
1564  inline void set_predicate_false_future(Future f);
1565  inline void set_predicate_false_result(UntypedBuffer arg);
1566  public:
1567  inline void set_independent_requirements(bool independent);
1568  public:
1569  TaskID task_id;
1570  std::vector<IndexSpaceRequirement> index_requirements;
1571  std::vector<RegionRequirement> region_requirements;
1572  std::vector<Future> futures;
1573  std::vector<Grant> grants;
1574  std::vector<PhaseBarrier> wait_barriers;
1575  std::vector<PhaseBarrier> arrive_barriers;
1576  UntypedBuffer argument;
1577  Predicate predicate;
1578  MapperID map_id;
1579  MappingTagID tag;
1580  UntypedBuffer map_arg;
1581  DomainPoint point;
1582  // Only used in control replication contexts for
1583  // doing sharding. If left unspecified the runtime
1584  // will use an index space of size 1 containing 'point'
1585  IndexSpace sharding_space;
1586  public:
1587  // If the predicate is set to anything other than
1588  // Predicate::TRUE_PRED, then the application must
1589  // specify a value for the future in the case that
1590  // the predicate resolves to false. UntypedBuffer(NULL,0)
1591  // can be used if the task's return type is void.
1592  Future predicate_false_future;
1593  UntypedBuffer predicate_false_result;
1594  public:
1595  // Provenance string for the runtime and tools to use
1596  std::string provenance;
1597  public:
1598  // Inform the runtime about any static dependences
1599  // These will be ignored outside of static traces
1600  const std::vector<StaticDependence> *static_dependences;
1601  public:
1602  // Users can tell the runtime this task is eligible
1603  // for inlining by the mapper. This will invoke the
1604  // select_task_options call inline as part of the launch
1605  // logic for this task to allow the mapper to decide
1606  // whether to inline the task or not. Note that if the
1607  // mapper pre-empts during execution then resuming it
1608  // may take a long time if another long running task
1609  // gets scheduled on the processor that launched this task.
1610  bool enable_inlining;
1611  public:
1612  // In some cases users (most likely compilers) will want
1613  // to run a light-weight function (e.g. a continuation)
1614  // as a task that just depends on futures once those futures
1615  // are ready on a local processor where the parent task
1616  // is executing. We call this a local function task and it
1617  // must not have any region requirements. It must als be a
1618  // pure function with no side effects. This task will
1619  // not have the option of being distributed to remote nodes.
1620  bool local_function_task;
1621  public:
1622  // Users can inform the runtime that all region requirements
1623  // are independent of each other in this task. Independent
1624  // means that either field sets are independent or region
1625  // requirements are disjoint based on the region tree.
1626  bool independent_requirements;
1627  public:
1628  // Instruct the runtime that it does not need to produce
1629  // a future or future map result for this index task
1630  bool elide_future_return;
1631  public:
1632  bool silence_warnings;
1633  };

1936  const RegionRequirement &src_idx_req,
1937  bool is_range_indirection = false);
1938  inline RegionRequirement& add_dst_indirect_field(
1939  const RegionRequirement &dst_idx_req,
1940  bool is_range_indirection = false);
1941  public:
1942  inline void add_grant(Grant g);
1943  inline void add_wait_barrier(PhaseBarrier bar);
1944  inline void add_arrival_barrier(PhaseBarrier bar);
1945  inline void add_wait_handshake(LegionHandshake handshake);
1946  inline void add_arrival_handshake(LegionHandshake handshake);
1947  public:
1948  std::vector<RegionRequirement> src_requirements;
1949  std::vector<RegionRequirement> dst_requirements;
1950  std::vector<RegionRequirement> src_indirect_requirements;
1951  std::vector<RegionRequirement> dst_indirect_requirements;
1952  std::vector<bool> src_indirect_is_range;
1953  std::vector<bool> dst_indirect_is_range;
1954  std::vector<Grant> grants;
1955  std::vector<PhaseBarrier> wait_barriers;
1956  std::vector<PhaseBarrier> arrive_barriers;
1957  Domain launch_domain;
1958  IndexSpace launch_space;
1959  // Will only be used in control replication context. If left
1960  // unset the runtime will use launch_domain/launch_space
1961  IndexSpace sharding_space;
1962  Predicate predicate;
1963  MapperID map_id;
1964  MappingTagID tag;
1965  UntypedBuffer map_arg;
1966  public:
1967  // Provenance string for the runtime and tools to use
1968  std::string provenance;
1969  public:
1970  // Inform the runtime about any static dependences
1971  // These will be ignored outside of static traces
1972  const std::vector<StaticDependence> *static_dependences;
1973  public:
1974  // Whether the source and destination indirections can lead
1975  // to out-of-range access into the instances to skip
1976  bool possible_src_indirect_out_of_range;
1977  bool possible_dst_indirect_out_of_range;
1978  // Whether the destination indirection can lead to aliasing
1979  // in the destination instances requiring synchronization
1980  bool possible_dst_indirect_aliasing;
1981  // Whether the individual point copies should operate collectively
1982  // together in the case of indirect copies (e.g. allow indirections
1983  // to refer to instances from other points). These settings have
1984  // no effect in the case of copies without indirections.
1985  bool collective_src_indirect_points;
1986  bool collective_dst_indirect_points;
1987  public:
1988  bool silence_warnings;
1989  };

2583  class PhysicalRegion : public Unserializable<PhysicalRegion> {
2584  public:

2586  PhysicalRegion(const PhysicalRegion &rhs);
2587  PhysicalRegion(PhysicalRegion &&rhs) noexcept;
2588  ~PhysicalRegion(void);
2589  private:
2590  Internal::PhysicalRegionImpl *impl;
2591  protected:
2592  FRIEND_ALL_RUNTIME_CLASSES
2593  explicit PhysicalRegion(Internal::PhysicalRegionImpl *impl);
2594  public:
2595  PhysicalRegion& operator=(const PhysicalRegion &rhs);
2596  PhysicalRegion& operator=(PhysicalRegion &&rhs) noexcept;
2597  inline bool exists(void) const { return (impl != NULL); }
2598  inline bool operator==(const PhysicalRegion &reg) const
2599  { return (impl == reg.impl); }
2600  inline bool operator<(const PhysicalRegion &reg) const
2601  { return (impl < reg.impl); }
2602  public:
2606  bool is_mapped(void) const;
2614  void wait_until_valid(bool silence_warnings = false,
2615  const char *warning_string = NULL);

2630  PrivilegeMode get_privilege(void) const;

2635  bool silence_warnings = false,
2636  const char *warning_string = NULL) const;

2641  public:
2642  template<int DIM, typename COORD_T>
2643  DomainT<DIM,COORD_T> get_bounds(void) const;
2644  // We'll also allow this to implicitly cast to a realm index space
2645  // so that users can easily iterate over the points
2646  template<int DIM, typename COORD_T>
2647  operator DomainT<DIM,COORD_T>(void) const;

3962  class OutputRegion : public Unserializable<OutputRegion> {
3963  public:
3964  OutputRegion(void);

3966  ~OutputRegion(void);
3967  private:
3968  Internal::OutputRegionImpl *impl;
3969  protected:
3970  FRIEND_ALL_RUNTIME_CLASSES
3971  explicit OutputRegion(Internal::OutputRegionImpl *impl);
3972  public:
3973  OutputRegion& operator=(const OutputRegion &rhs);
3974  public:
3975  Memory target_memory(void) const;
3976  // Returns the logical region of this output region.
3977  // The call is legal only when the output region is valid and
3978  // will raise an error otherwise.
3979  LogicalRegion get_logical_region(void) const;
3980  bool is_valid_output_region(void) const;
3981  public:
3982  // Returns a deferred buffer that satisfies the layout constraints of
3983  // this output region. The caller still needs to pass this buffer to
3984  // a return_data call if the buffer needs to be bound to this output
3985  // region. The caller can optionally choose to bind the returned buffer
3986  // to the output region; such a call cannot be made more than once.
3987  template<typename T,
3988  int DIM,
3989  typename COORD_T = coord_t,
3990 #ifdef LEGION_BOUNDS_CHECKS
3991  bool CHECK_BOUNDS = true>
3992 #else
3993  bool CHECK_BOUNDS = false>
3994 #endif
3995  DeferredBuffer<T,DIM,COORD_T,CHECK_BOUNDS>
3996  create_buffer(const Point<DIM, COORD_T> &extents,

3999  bool return_buffer = false);
4000  private:

4004  std::vector<DimensionKind> &ordering,
4005  size_t &alignment) const;
4006  public:
4007  template<typename T,
4008  int DIM,
4009  typename COORD_T = coord_t,
4010 #ifdef LEGION_BOUNDS_CHECKS
4011  bool CHECK_BOUNDS = true>
4012 #else
4013  bool CHECK_BOUNDS = false>
4014 #endif
4015  void return_data(const Point<DIM,COORD_T> &extents,
4016  FieldID field_id,
4017  DeferredBuffer<T,DIM,COORD_T,CHECK_BOUNDS> &buffer);

4019  FieldID field_id,
4020  Realm::RegionInstance instance,

4022  private:

4305  class Mappable {

4307  Mappable(void);
4308  public:
4309  // Return a globally unique ID for this operation
4310  virtual UniqueID get_unique_id(void) const = 0;

4312  // this operation in the same context (close operations

4321  // you can also get the machine component as well

4333  virtual const Partition* as_partition(void) const { return NULL; }
4334  virtual const MustEpoch* as_must_epoch(void) const { return NULL; }
4335  public:

4337  MappingTagID tag;
4338  public:

4340  // It's better to use the 'get_parent_task' method
4341  // as this may be NULL until that method is called
4342  mutable const Task* parent_task;
4343  public:
4344  // Mapper annotated data
4345  void* mapper_data;
4346  size_t mapper_data_size;
4347  public:
4348  // These are here for backwards compatibility from a time when
4349  // the MappableType enum was inside of this class
4350 #ifndef __GNUC__
4351  // GCC doesn't like this line even though it's just creating a
4352  // type alias, who knows what their problem is
4353  typedef Legion::MappableType MappableType;
4354 #endif
4355  static const MappableType TASK_MAPPABLE = ::LEGION_TASK_MAPPABLE;
4356  static const MappableType COPY_MAPPABLE = ::LEGION_COPY_MAPPABLE;
4357  static const MappableType INLINE_MAPPABLE = ::LEGION_INLINE_MAPPABLE;

4376  class Task : public Mappable {
4377  public:
4378  Task(void);
4379  public:
4380  // Check whether this task has a parent task.
4381  virtual bool has_parent_task(void) const = 0;
4382  // Return the name of the task.
4383  virtual const char* get_task_name(void) const = 0;
4384  // Returns the current slice of the index domain that this
4385  // task is operating over. This method will only return a
4386  // valid domain if this is part of an index space task.
4387  virtual Domain get_slice_domain(void) const = 0;
4388  //------------------------------------------------------------------------
4389  // Control Replication methods
4390  // In general SPMD-style programming in Legion is wrong. If you find
4391  // yourself writing SPMD-style code for large fractions of your program
4392  // then you're probably doing something wrong. There are a few exceptions:
4393  // 1. index attach/detach operations are collective and may need
4394  // to do per-shard work
4395  // 2. I/O in general often needs to do per-shard work
4396  // 3. interaction with collective frameworks like MPI and NCCL
4397  // 4. others?
4398  // For these reasons we allow users to get access to sharding information
4399  // Please, please, please be careful with how you use it
4400  //------------------------------------------------------------------------
4401  virtual ShardID get_shard_id(void) const = 0;
4402  virtual size_t get_total_shards(void) const = 0;
4403  virtual DomainPoint get_shard_point(void) const = 0;
4404  virtual Domain get_shard_domain(void) const = 0;
4405  public:
4406  virtual MappableType get_mappable_type(void) const
4407  { return LEGION_TASK_MAPPABLE; }
4408  virtual const Task* as_task(void) const { return this; }
4409  public:
4410  // Task argument information
4411  TaskID task_id;
4412  std::vector<IndexSpaceRequirement> indexes;
4413  std::vector<RegionRequirement> regions;
4414  std::vector<OutputRequirement> output_regions;
4415  std::vector<Future> futures;
4416  std::vector<Grant> grants;
4417  std::vector<PhaseBarrier> wait_barriers;
4418  std::vector<PhaseBarrier> arrive_barriers;
4419  void* args;
4420  size_t arglen;
4421  public:
4422  // Index task argument information
4423  bool is_index_space;
4424  bool concurrent_task;
4425  bool must_epoch_task;
4426  Domain index_domain;
4427  DomainPoint index_point;
4428  IndexSpace sharding_space;
4429  void* local_args;
4430  size_t local_arglen;
4431  public:
4432  // Meta data information from the runtime
4433  Processor orig_proc;
4434  Processor current_proc;
4435  Processor target_proc;
4436  unsigned steal_count;
4437  bool stealable;
4438  bool speculated;
4439  bool local_function;
4440  };

10304  // This method is hidden down here and not publicly documented because
10305  // users shouldn't really need it for anything, however there are some
10306  // reasonable cases where it might be utilitized for things like doing
10307  // file I/O or printf that people might want it for so we've got it
10308  ShardID get_shard_id(Context ctx, bool I_know_what_I_am_doing = false);
10309  // We'll also allow users to get the total number of shards in the context
10310  // if they also ar willing to attest they know what they are doing
10311  size_t get_num_shards(Context ctx, bool I_know_what_I_am_doing = false);
10312  // This is another hidden method for control replication because it's
10313  // still somewhat experimental. In some cases there are unavoidable
10314  // sources of randomness that can mess with the needed invariants for
10315  // control replication (e.g. garbage collectors). This method will
10316  // allow the application to pass in an array of elements from each shard
10317  // and the runtime will fill in an output buffer with an ordered array of
10318  // elements that were passed in by every shard. Each shard will get the
10319  // same elements that were present in all the other shards in the same
10320  // order in the output array. The number of elements in the output buffer
10321  // is returned as a future (of type size_t) as the runtime will return
10322  // immediately and the application can continue running ahead. The
10323  // application must keep the input and output buffers allocated until
10324  // the future resolves. By definition the output buffer need be no bigger
10325  // than the input buffer since only elements that are in the input buffer
10326  // on any shard can appear in the output buffer. Note you can use this
10327  // method safely in contexts that are not control replicated as well:
10328  // the input will just be mem-copied to the output and num_elements
10329  // returned as the future result.
10330  Future consensus_match(Context ctx, const void *input, void *output,
10331  size_t num_elements, size_t element_size, const char *provenance = NULL);
10332  private:
10333  friend class Mapper;
10334  Internal::Runtime *runtime;
10335  };
